snippet: Federal officials said the ring sold nearly 20 kilograms of heroin in the past nine months, and included a retired police officer.
abstract: Twenty people are arrested in a sophisticated heroin distribution ring that extended from Brooklyn to Long Island; federal indictment says ring, led by Jose Perez, sold nearly 20 kilograms of heroin with a street value of $2.75 million in the past nine months.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials said the ring sold nearly 20 kilograms of heroin in the past nine months, and included a retired police officer.

headline.seo: 20 Accused of Heroin Dealing in N.Y.C. and Long Island
headline.main: 20 Charged as U.S. Says Heroin Ring Is Broken Up
headline.print_headline: 20 Charged As U.S. Says Heroin Ring Is Broken Up
